result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas W Blackburn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Intimidate Victim/Threaten Force, etc. [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Good faith effort to seek/maintain employment

Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia.  
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.  
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional.  
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription.
Not possess any dangerous weapons.
Not to be in the company of others under the influence.  
No contact directly or indirectly with victims unless approved by the agent.

Counseling/assessments deemed appropriate by agent.
Sign all releases for the agent.
Cooperate with Child Protective Services(CPS), follow all their orders.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
